So this morning my dorm room bathroom ran out of soap, and I left to buy some
column2: more at the store. Luck was on my side, as I noticed while browsing the Lego section that this polybag&nbsp
column3: was on display for sell. I snatched it up along with &quot
column6: which was also on display. This polybag has been a great little set to piece together. I was excited to build the polybag, since its set designer Justin Ramsden was recently interviewed by Brickset.

column2: t normally care for packaging, and this is just a simple polybag. The instructions are on one piece of paper, which was details on both sides.

column1: There are a lot of parts here that will excite a Lego builder. There are FIVE minifigure heads decorated with a print to represent Venom'
column2: s mouth. There are a few &quot
column4: in the arms, and there is also one example of this 1x2 plate with teeth:&nbsp

column2: height: 480px

included in the set is the plain and simple Spider-Man that has been produced since 2012, with a Super-Jumper as his only accessory. I know fans have mixed feelings about this version of Lego Spidey, and I still profess that my favorite Lego Spider-Man is the highly detailed version made for the&nbsp
column4: a decade ago. However I am glad to finally have this &quot
column6: Spider-Man, especially since it appears his MCU appearance in Captain America 3 will look a lot like the cartoon versions of the character. My only complaint is I wish he had come with a rope for webslinging instead of a Super-Jumper.

column2: t own any Mixel sets, but I felt building the Venom Symbiote that I was building a &quot
column4: The build is centered on building a frame, and then attaching limbs and appendages to it. It is basic, but surprisingly satisfying for a $5 set.

column2: height: 480px

is about the size of my palm. It has a lot of limbs and legs that can be adjusted, and when the legs are placed so the figure is as tall as it can go, it is about 2 1/2 times taller than a standard minifigure. The disjointed look of the build suits the nightmarish nature of the Venom Symbiote as seen in films and comics.
height: 480px
font-size: 20px

column1: This is a great impulse buy set. I feel like it was worth the five dollar asking price, and I feel like it is a worthy addition to my Marvel themed sets. I found mine at a Smith'
column2: s Marketplace, although judging by rumors online it might be more commonly seen in Target stores (at least in the US). If you are lucky enough to find this set in a store, don&#39
column3: t pass on the opportunity to get it!

column1: The instructions are pretty easy to follow, as you would expect from a single sheet.
column2: I modified the sub-build in step 8, swapping around the parts on one copy to add a more pleasing bilateral symmetry. &nbsp
column3: However, having said that, intentionally breaking the symmetry - which I plan to experiment with - adds to the creepiness of the symbiote. &nbsp
column4: Go with what pleases your aethetics the most.

column2: s a fairly big part count for this polybag, and having five Venom heads, and seven claws makes this a part-tastic set. &nbsp
column4: toothed plate - which makes the body the sixth head in effect. &nbsp
column5: The clear 2x2 round on the bottom is a smart way to lend stability to the model without making it look clunky.

column1: The Mixel joints are used to great purpose. &nbsp
column2: While I don&#39
column3: t care for the Mixels line in general, I am so grateful for these wonderful parts I associate with it.

column1: The Spiderman minifigure is nothing new for long-time collectors like myself.
column2: But, imagine you&#39
column3: re a kid getting her first superheroes set. &nbsp
column5: You get a hero and a spine-tinglingly cool villian, for instant playablility without breaking the bank. &nbsp
column6: If there had been a new print job, or a rarer one, for this Spiderman, secondary market prices would quickly push the set to well beyond the reasonable. &nbsp
column8: s going to become expensive enough in the future as it is.

column1: And I think that something we tend to forget as AFOLs, is how much we wanted things like this set when we only had a few dollars&#39
column2: worth of allowance. &nbsp
column3: If it gets more kids into LEGO because more parents can justify the cost, then I&#39

column1: This is serioulsy one of the best sets I have.
column3: s awesome, and totally fun to build, and then make a wee diorama for. &nbsp
column4: Even as I write this, my daughter is reconfiguring the claws to make them look more like they are attacking Spiderman. &nbsp
column5: I will probably switch out as many of the grey parts as I can for black, just to appease my tastes, but most kids aren&#39
column6: t likely going to care, because the Symbiote is just so frikken&#39

column2: I bought three of them. &nbsp
column3: One for me, one for my daughter, and one for whatever reason compels me to buy multiple polybags. &nbsp
column4: Maybe as a gift in the future for my grandchildren. &nbsp
column5: I seriously think I should go buy more - and use the parts to make my Symbiote bigger and badder. &nbsp
column6: It really is excellent value for money. &nbsp
column7: It will definitely go up in price later on the secondary market, so if you see it any where, pay retail! &nbsp
column8: This is a must for any LEGO Marvel Superheroes collection.

column1:
,TRUE,5,5,5,5,5 Faefrost","2016-12-16T05:17:22.183Z","A delightfully creepy little Polybag set","

Ok there isn'
column2: t too much to say about this one. It is a strange and completely unexpected Polybag set. One based around one of the cooler and more disturbing Lego creations ever dreamed up. From Spider-Man we have the Venom Symbiote. This is not the traditional &quot
column4: Venom symbiote bonded to Eddie Brock as we got in an earlier set. This is the amorphous shape shifting un-bonded goo form. The tentacled Lovecraftian Horror. And boy is it MAGNIFICENT! It&#39
column5: s like a macabre evil demonic Mixel. Simply wonderful.&nbsp

column1: What you see on the bag is what you get. Standard traditional Spider-Man (sadly not the 2 color leg version) A useless Super Jumper (otherwise known as the "
column2: Leg Breaker&quot
column3: ) And the parts for the Symbiote. Lots of angles and hinges. Black Chima type Spider Legs, and Count Em! Five! FIVE! Glorious Venom heads.&nbsp

column2: Lego has ever released. It will give your kid nightmares. But in the best and most fun possible way. fantastic Value for a cheap Polybag.&nbsp
